## Objetivo
Let's decrypt this: ciphertext? Something seems a bit small.

## Pistas
- RSA tutorial: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(cryptosystem)
- How could having too small an e affect the security of this 2048 bit key?
- Make sure you don't lose precision, the numbers are pretty big (besides the e value)

## Solución
```
mrfear@nightmare:~/winhome/Desktop$ wget https://jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org/static/eb5e6df8e14c52873cf88c582a1a4008/ciphertext
```

```powershell
C:\Users\mgarcia\Desktop>type ciphertext
```

```bash
mrfear@nightmare:~/winhome/Desktop$ python
Python 3.12.2 (main, Feb 21 2024, 00:00:00) [GCC 13.2.1 20231205 (Red Hat 13.2.1-6)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from Crypto.Util.number import *
>>> from gmpy2 import *
>>> gmpy2.get_context().precision=2048
>>> e=3
>>> c=2205316413931134031074603746928247799030155221252519872650080519263755075355825243327515211479747536697517688468095325517209911688684309894900992899707504087647575997847717180766377832435022794675332132906451858990782325436498952049751141
>>> root, exact = iroot(c,e)
>>> root
mpz(13016382529449106065894479374027604750406953699090365388203722801043052339225981)
>>> print(long_to_bytes(root))
b'picoCTF{n33d_a_lArg3r_e_d0cd6eae}'
>>>
```


Solución 2
Primero usaremos un script en python y obtendremos el resultado
```
from gmpy2 import *

gmpy2.get_context().precision = 2048
n = 
e = 3
c = 2205316413931134031074603746928247799030155221252519872650080519263755075355825243327515211479747536697517688468095325517209911688684309894900992899707504087647575997847717180766377832435022794675332132906451858990782325436498952049751141

for t in range(1000):
    m, tr=iroot(n*t+c,e)
    if tr:
        print("Encontre t =", t)
        print("Mensaje    =", bytes.fromhex(hex(m)[2:]))
        break
```

Y después obtendremos esta salida para la ejecución del programa
```
C:\Users\mgarcia\Desktop>python exploitminirsa.py
Encontre t = 0
Mensaje    = b'picoCTF{n33d_a_lArg3r_e_d0cd6eae}'
```
